Package neqsim.physicalProperties.interfaceProperties.surfaceTension

Class GTSurfaceTensionFullGT

  • java.lang.Object
    • neqsim.physicalProperties.interfaceProperties.surfaceTension.GTSurfaceTensionFullGT
  • public class GTSurfaceTensionFullGT
extends Object

    GTSurfaceTensionFullGT class. Solving for the surface tension by direct Newton method.
    todo: Makeuse of binary interaction parameter for the influence parameter \f$\beta_{ij}\f$ when this becomes available in NeqSIM API.

    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Olaf Trygve Berglihn olaf.trygve.berglihn@sintef.no, John C. Morud john.c.morud@sintef.no

      • Newton

        public static double Newton​(double[][] cij,
                            double L,
                            int N_Newton,
                            double allowedRelChange,
                            boolean highOrder,
                            boolean directMethod,
                            double[][] rhomat,
                            SystemInterface sys,
                            int ncomp,
                            double t,
                            double[] mueq)

        Newton. Calculate surface tension by full gradient method and Newtons method The routine solves the Finite Difference equations for the full Gradient Theory by Newtons method. Note that the length coordinate is in nm-units. Method: 1. Calculate delta_mu and its Jacobian 2. Call routine "directsolve" for Newton step 3. Dampen the step if relative step too large 4. Iterate until convergence or max #iterations (N_Newton)

        Parameters:
        cij - an array of double objects
        L - a double
        N_Newton - a int
        allowedRelChange - a double
        highOrder - a boolean
        directMethod - a boolean
        rhomat - an array of double objects
        sys - a SystemInterface object
        ncomp - a int
        t - a double
        mueq - an array of double objects
        Returns:
        sigma The surface tension [N/m]

      • directsolve

        public static void directsolve​(double[][] rres,
                               double[][][] JJ,
                               double[][] C,
                               double H,
                               int Ngrid,
                               double[][] rhomat,
                               int ncomp)

        directsolve. Solve linear system for Full Gradient method

        Parameters:
        rres - an array of double objects
        JJ - an array of double objects
        C - an array of double objects
        H - a double
        Ngrid - a int
        rhomat - an array of double objects
        ncomp - a int

      • sigmaCalc

        public static double sigmaCalc​(double h,
                               double[][] rrho,
                               double[][] C,
                               boolean highOrder,
                               double[][] drhodz,
                               int ncomp)

        sigmaCalc. Calculates the interface tension The following integral is solved with the trapezoidal method: \f{equation}{ \sigma = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \boldsymbol{n_z}^T \boldsymbol{C} \boldsymbol{n_z} \, dz \f}

        Parameters:
        h - a double
        rrho - an array of double objects
        C - an array of double objects
        highOrder - a boolean
        drhodz - an array of double objects
        ncomp - a int
        Returns:
        sigma The surface tension [N/m]

      • calc_std_integral

        public double calc_std_integral​(double[] z,
                                double[][] C,
                                double[][] drhodz)

        calc_std_integral. Calculate width of interface region (length scale) Estimate the width of interface by calculating the second moment of the surface tension integrand. Used to adjust the domain size

        Parameters:
        z - an array of double objects
        C - an array of double objects
        drhodz - an array of double objects
        Returns:
        Interface width (length scale) [nm]

        Parameters:

        ncomp - a int
